str2: A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.
